<@194432762315407360> I'm working on upgrading the goethereum dependency for Prysm, as part of this we are using discv5 and have a few tests using the listeners created by discv5.
There seems to be a table that gets initialized when the listener is created in a separate go thread but i haven't found a way to figure out how to know when the table is done initializing.
this results in out test looking like
```
    bootListener, err := s.createListener(ipAddr, pkey)
    require.NoError(t, err)
    defer bootListener.Close()
    
    time.Sleep(5 * time.Second)
```
because we don't know when the table is done. is there a way to check for this or would you be accepting any feature request to get something added so I can check against it ðŸ˜…
